Structs/RomanNumeral/Berklee.html#/s:11M.name: offsets
Structs/RomanNumeral/Berklee.html#/s:11M.abstract: Offsets-from-tonic for the current instance (values can be > 12).

Structs/RomanNumeral/Berklee.html#/s:11M.name: pcset
Structs/RomanNumeral/Berklee.html#/s:11M.abstract: Offsets-from-tonic as a pitch-class set (may negate inversion).

Structs/RomanNumeral/Berklee.html#/s:11M.name: init(_:)
Structs/RomanNumeral/Berklee.html#/s:11M.abstract: Initialize from a string containing a roman numeral symbol. E.g. RomanNumeral.Berklee(Imaj7#9)

Structs/RomanNumeral/Berklee.html#/s:11M.name: mapRN(_:)
Structs/RomanNumeral/Berklee.html#/s:11M.abstract: Helper function to map the roman numeral portion of the symbol to an initial offset value.

Structs/RomanNumeral/Berklee.html#/s:11M.name: pitchClasses(in:)
Structs/RomanNumeral/Berklee.html#/s:11M.abstract: Returns a pitch-class set corresponding to the current roman numeral instance, as it applies to the specified key (may negate inversion).

Structs/RomanNumeral/Berklee.html#/s:11M.name: toMIDI(bassOctave:)
Structs/RomanNumeral/Berklee.html#/s:11M.abstract: Map a roman numeral’s offsets to a particular key and octave, in the style of MIDI note numbers.

Structs/RomanNumeral/Traditional.html#/s.name: options
Structs/RomanNumeral/Traditional.html#/s.abstract: All available roman numeral strings as an array of strings.

Structs/RomanNumeral/Traditional.html#/s.name: offsets
Structs/RomanNumeral/Traditional.html#/s.abstract: Offsets-from-tonic for the current instance (values can be > 12).

Structs/RomanNumeral/Traditional.html#/s.name: pcset
Structs/RomanNumeral/Traditional.html#/s.abstract: Offsets-from-tonic as a pitch-class set (may negate inversion).

Structs/RomanNumeral/Traditional.html#/s.name: init(_:)
Structs/RomanNumeral/Traditional.html#/s.abstract: Initialize from a string containing a roman numeral symbol. E.g. RomanNumeral.Traditional(viiÂº7)

Structs/RomanNumeral/Traditional.html#/s.name: toMIDI(in:bassOctave:)
Structs/RomanNumeral/Traditional.html#/s.abstract: Map a roman numeral’s offsets to a particular key and octave, in the style of MIDI note numbers.

Structs/RomanNumeral/Traditional.html#/s.name: offsets(in:)
Structs/RomanNumeral/Traditional.html#/s.abstract: Map a roman numeral’s offsets to a particular key.

Structs/RomanNumeral/Traditional.html.name: Traditional
Structs/RomanNumeral/Traditional.html.abstract: The Traditional roman numeral type uses figured-bass notation and both upper and lower case characters. Examples:

Structs/RomanNumeral/Berklee.html.name: Berklee
Structs/RomanNumeral/Berklee.html.abstract: The Berklee roman numeral type uses chord-symbol style notation and only upper case characters, as is used in the system of harmony taught to undergraduates in the Berkee College of Music’s core jazz-based harmony courses. Examples:

Structs/Tempo.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Temp.name: softLimit
Structs/Tempo.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Temp.abstract: An internal soft limit that can be modified. Defaults to 400.0.

Structs/Tempo.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Temp.name: init(_:_:)
Structs/Tempo.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Temp.abstract: Initialize with a note value and a BPM value, e.g. Tempo(.d_4, 140).

Structs/Tempo.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Temp.name: init(_:)
Structs/Tempo.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Temp.abstract: Initialize with a BPM value alone, e.g. Tempo(116.5). Beat value defaults to .n_4, or a quarter-note.

Structs/Tempo.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Temp.name: init(description:)
Structs/Tempo.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Temp.abstract: Initialize from a string describing the tempo, e.g. Tempo(Presto). Generates a random value within a range (e.g. 115 - 140 for Allegro).

Structs/TimeSignature.html#/s:11Musician.name: init(_:_:)
Structs/TimeSignature.html#/s:11Musician.abstract: Initialize from a numerator and a denominator, e.g. TimeSignature(4, 4).

Structs/SeparatedChordSymbol.html#/s:11M.name: init(_:_:)
Structs/SeparatedChordSymbol.html#/s:11M.abstract: Initialize with a chord root and a chord suffix string, without argument labels.

Structs/SeparatedChordSymbol.html#/s:11M.name: getPitchClasses()
Structs/SeparatedChordSymbol.html#/s:11M.abstract: Get a pitch-class set of the suffix as it would apply to C (pitch-class 0).

Structs/Chord.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Chor.name: key
Structs/Chord.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Chor.abstract: The chord’s key context, useful for certain operations. Defaults to C Major. Expressed as a tuplet (Key, KeyType).

Structs/Chord.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Chor.name: tones
Structs/Chord.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Chor.abstract: The chord represented as scale degrees, if available, according to the ‘key’ property.

Structs/Chord.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Chor.name: init(_:)
Structs/Chord.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Chor.abstract: Initialize from a chord symbol. E.g. Chord(Gbm7).

Structs/Chord.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Chor.name: parse(_:)
Structs/Chord.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Chor.abstract: Parse a chord symbol and return an Optional. Returns nil if the chord symbol could not be parsed.

Structs/Chord.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Chor.name: voiceLead(from:to:)
Structs/Chord.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Chor.abstract: Use the Chord abstraction to voice-lead from one set of MIDI note numbers to another. E.g. Chord.voiceLead(from: [60, 64, 67], to: Chord(Fmaj7)).

Structs/ToneMatrix.html#/s:11MusicianKit.name: getRowForm(_:offset:)
Structs/ToneMatrix.html#/s:11MusicianKit.abstract: Get a prticular row form from the matrix.

Structs/ToneMatrix.html#/s:11MusicianKit.name: getRowFormNon12(_:offset:ed:)
Structs/ToneMatrix.html#/s:11MusicianKit.abstract: Get a prticular row form from the matrix in an arbitrary equal division of the octave/diapason.

Structs/PCSet.html#/s:11MusicianKit5PCSe.name: init(with:)
Structs/PCSet.html#/s:11MusicianKit5PCSe.abstract: Initialize from an array of MIDI note numbers.

Structs/PCSet.html#/s:11MusicianKit5PCSe.name: init(arrayLiteral:)
Structs/PCSet.html#/s:11MusicianKit5PCSe.abstract: Initialize as an array literal of PitchClasses. For example:

Structs/PCSet.html#/s:11MusicianKit5PCSe.name: init(_:)
Structs/PCSet.html#/s:11MusicianKit5PCSe.abstract: Initialize from a Forte code string. E.g. PCSet(4-Z15) returns [0, 1, 4, 6]

Structs/PCSet.html#/s:11MusicianKit5PCSe.name: cardinality
Structs/PCSet.html#/s:11MusicianKit5PCSe.abstract: Returns the number of unique elements in the current PCSet instance.

Structs/PCSet.html#/s:11MusicianKit5PCSe.name: thinned()
Structs/PCSet.html#/s:11MusicianKit5PCSe.abstract: Returns an ordered replica of the current PCSet with duplicates removed.

Structs/PCSet.html#/s:11MusicianKit5PCSe.name: forteCode
Structs/PCSet.html#/s:11MusicianKit5PCSe.abstract: Returns the Forte code of the current PCSet if one can be found that matches.

Structs/PCSet.html#/s:11MusicianKit5PCSe.name: getNormalForm()
Structs/PCSet.html#/s:11MusicianKit5PCSe.abstract: Returns the normal form of the current PCSet.

Structs/PCSet.html#/s:11MusicianKit5PCSe.name: getPrimeForm()
Structs/PCSet.html#/s:11MusicianKit5PCSe.abstract: Returns the prime form of the current PCSet.

Structs/PCSet.html#/s:11MusicianKit5PCSe.name: inverted()
Structs/PCSet.html#/s:11MusicianKit5PCSe.abstract: Returns an inversion of the current PCSet.

Structs/PCSet.html#/s:11MusicianKit5PCSe.name: transposed(_:)
Structs/PCSet.html#/s:11MusicianKit5PCSe.abstract: Returns a transposition of the current PCSet.

Structs/PCSet.html#/s:11MusicianKit5PCSe.name: transformed(t:i:)
Structs/PCSet.html#/s:11MusicianKit5PCSe.abstract: Returns a transposition and/or inversion of the current PCSet.

Structs/PCSet.html#/s:11MusicianKit5PCSe.name: transform(t:i:)
Structs/PCSet.html#/s:11MusicianKit5PCSe.abstract: Performs a compound transformation (inversion and transposition) on the current PCSet.

Structs/ToneRow.html#/s:11MusicianKit7To.name: buildMatrix()
Structs/ToneRow.html#/s:11MusicianKit7To.abstract: Generate a ToneMatrix from the current ToneRow.

Structs/NoteSequence.html#/s:11MusicianK.name: init(duration:velocity:pitches:)
Structs/NoteSequence.html#/s:11MusicianK.abstract: Initialize from a single duration and single velocity applied to multiple pitches.

Structs/NoteSequence.html#/s:11MusicianK.name: init(durations:velocities:pitches:)
Structs/NoteSequence.html#/s:11MusicianK.abstract: Initialize from a single duration and single velocity applied to multiple pitches.

Structs/NoteSequence.html#/s:11MusicianK.name: toMusicSequence(on:)
Structs/NoteSequence.html#/s:11MusicianK.abstract: Export NoteSequence instance as a MusicSequence object. Needs testing.

Structs/Note.html#/s:11MusicianKit4NoteV.name: init(_:_:_:)
Structs/Note.html#/s:11MusicianKit4NoteV.abstract: Initialize from initial pitch, duration, and velocity values.

Structs/Pitch.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Pitc.name: midiValue
Structs/Pitch.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Pitc.abstract: A MIDI note number representation, for practical purposes.

Structs/Pitch.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Pitc.name: init(_:_:)
Structs/Pitch.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Pitc.abstract: Initialize from a PitchClass and an integer denoting octave.

Structs/Pitch.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Pitc.name: init(_:_:)
Structs/Pitch.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Pitc.abstract: Initialize from a PitchLetter and an integer denoting octave.

Structs/Pitch.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Pitc.name: init(_:)
Structs/Pitch.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Pitc.abstract: Initialize from a description string, e.g. Pitch(Eb5).

Structs/Mode.html#/s:11MusicianKit4ModeV.name: init(modeName:modeOffsets:)
Structs/Mode.html#/s:11MusicianKit4ModeV.abstract: Initialize from a name string and offsets-from-tonic Int array.

Structs/Mode.html#/s:11MusicianKit4ModeV.name: init(modeName:pcset:)
Structs/Mode.html#/s:11MusicianKit4ModeV.abstract: Initialize from a name string and a pitch-class set (the prime form of which is used).

Structs/Mode.html#/s:11MusicianKit4ModeV.name: getMode(_:)
Structs/Mode.html#/s:11MusicianKit4ModeV.abstract: Get a mode of a Mode parent scale instance.

Structs/Mode.html.name: Mode
Structs/Mode.html.abstract: The Mode type is used for defining custom scale structures. Initialized with either a name string and an array of Int offsets-from-tonic, or with a name string and a pitch-class set (in which case the prime form is used).

Structs/Pitch.html.name: Pitch
Structs/Pitch.html.abstract: The Pitch type represents both a pitch class and an octave. It also contains a MIDI note number representation. Absolute pitch parity can be checked with ==, pitch class parity can be checked with ~=.

Structs/Note.html.name: Note
Structs/Note.html.abstract: The Note abstraction contains a Pitch instance, a Duration instance, and a velocity.

Structs/NoteSequence.html.name: NoteSequence
Structs/NoteSequence.html.abstract: The NoteSequence abstraction represents an ordered collection of Note objects.

Structs/ToneRow.html.name: ToneRow
Structs/ToneRow.html.abstract: The ToneRow type deals with ordered collections of pitch-classes and adds utility methods for working with tone rows in compositional contexts.

Structs/PCSet.html.name: PCSet
Structs/PCSet.html.abstract: The PCSet type deals with collections of pitch-classes. It abstracts an Array of pitch-classes than a set type, in order to allow for duplicates, explicit ordering, etc.

Structs/ToneMatrix.html.name: ToneMatrix
Structs/ToneMatrix.html.abstract: The ToneMatrix type deals with tone matrices expressed as multidimensional arrays, or arrays of ToneRow instances.

Structs/Chord.html.name: Chord
Structs/Chord.html.abstract: The Chord type provides an abstraction for dealing with vertically-oriented harmonic structures. Can be initialized with a pitch-class set, with a chord symbol (e.g. Chord(Fmaj7#11)), or with MIDI note numbers as an Int array. Chord parity, considering inversional equivalence, can be checked using the == operator.

Structs/SeparatedChordSymbol.html.name: SeparatedChordSymbol
Structs/SeparatedChordSymbol.html.abstract: The SeparatedChordSymbol type provides a separated root and symbol suffix, as an intermediary stage in the chord-parsing process.

Structs/TimeSignature.html.name: TimeSignature
Structs/TimeSignature.html.abstract: The TimeSignature type consists of a numerator and a denominator, together representing a time signature. It currently only supports dyadic rationals, but support for ‘irrational’ time signatures is planned.

Structs/Tempo.html.name: Tempo
Structs/Tempo.html.abstract: The Tempo type consists of a beats-per-minute value, and a NoteValue instance to indicate what each of these beats is. It can be initialized with a BPM value alone, in which case the beat’s value defaults to a quarter note, or with both together. Additionally, it can be initialized with a description, e.g. Tempo(Andante). There is an internal soft limit that defaults to 400.0 and can be user-modified.

Structs/RomanNumeral.html.name: RomanNumeral
Structs/RomanNumeral.html.abstract: The RomanNumeral type abstracts data and operations related to working with roman-numeral expressions of harmony. Two basic systems of roman-numerals are provided: ‘Traditional’ and ‘Berklee’, the former employing figured-bass notation and both upper and lower case characters, and the latter resembling chord symbols and using all upper case characters.

Extensions/String.html#/s:SS11MusicianKi.name: separateRoot()
Extensions/String.html#/s:SS11MusicianKi.abstract: Separate a chord symbol’s root from its suffix in a string and return both in a SeparatedChordSymbol instance.

Extensions/String.html#/s:SS11MusicianKi.name: mapPitch()
Extensions/String.html#/s:SS11MusicianKi.abstract: Map a string containing a pitch-letter to a pitch-class.

Extensions/String.html#/s:SS11MusicianKi.name: mapPitchToLetter()
Extensions/String.html#/s:SS11MusicianKi.abstract: Map a string containing a pitch-letter to a PitchLetter instance.

Extensions/String.html#/s:SS11MusicianKi.name: mapSuffix()
Extensions/String.html#/s:SS11MusicianKi.abstract: Parse a chord symbol’s suffix and get a pitch-class set from it as it would apply to C (pitch-class 0). E.g. m7.mapSuffix().

Extensions/String.html#/s:SS11MusicianKi.name: substring(_:_:)
Extensions/String.html#/s:SS11MusicianKi.abstract: Helper function to get substrings using a JavaScript-like interface.

Extensions/String.html.name: String
Extensions/String.html.abstract: Extensions to the String type to enable parsing chord symbols in a functional style.

Enums/PitchLetter.html#/s:11MusicianKit1.name: init(_:)
Enums/PitchLetter.html#/s:11MusicianKit1.abstract: Initialize a PitchLetter instance from a string describing it. E.g. PitchLetter(C#).

Enums/PitchLetter.html#/s:11MusicianKit1.name: PC
Enums/PitchLetter.html#/s:11MusicianKit1.abstract: The pitch class value of a PitchLetter case instance.

Enums/PitchLetter.html#/s:11MusicianKit1.name: all
Enums/PitchLetter.html#/s:11MusicianKit1.abstract: A dictionary to map strings to PitchLetter cases.

Enums/KeyType.html#/s:11MusicianKit7KeyT.name: pattern
Enums/KeyType.html#/s:11MusicianKit7KeyT.abstract: Semitonal offset pattern from 0 for the current instance.

Enums/KeyType.html.name: KeyType
Enums/KeyType.html.abstract: The KeyType enum distinguishes between major and minor keys and produces scale patterns for each.

Enums/PitchLetter.html.name: PitchLetter
Enums/PitchLetter.html.abstract: The PitchLetter type is an enum whose raw value is the pitch class. The convention used is Cs for C-sharp, and Eb for E-flat, etc. Note that these are octave-invariant abstractions, like pitch-classes but for more tonal contexts.

Enums/MatrixForm.html.name: MatrixForm
Enums/MatrixForm.html.abstract: MatrixForm** is an enum to help navigate ToneMatrix objects. The four forms available are p, i, r, and ri, corresponding to Prime, Inversion, Retrograde, and Retrograde-Inversion respectively.

Enums/NoteValue.html.name: NoteValue
Enums/NoteValue.html.abstract: The NoteValue enum type, with a Double rawValue, consists of scaling factors for use as standard durations. Plugged into the equation as described below, they will yield approx. durations (in seconds).

Enums/Transformation.html.name: Transformation
Enums/Transformation.html.abstract: The Transformation enum identifies types of neo-riemannian transformations. Available transformations: P, R, L, N, S, H.

Enums/ChordQuality.html.name: ChordQuality
Enums/ChordQuality.html.abstract: The ChordQuality enum identifies triadic chord qualities for easy use in transformational contexts.

Global Variables.html#/s:11MusicianKit6R.name: RNDict
Global Variables.html#/s:11MusicianKit6R.abstract: A dictionary mapping traditional roman numeral symbols to offset collections (as strings). Used for lookup internally by RomanNumeral.Traditional.

Global Variables.html#/s:11MusicianKit9f.name: forteDict
Global Variables.html#/s:11MusicianKit9f.abstract: A dictionary mapping pitch-class sets as strings to Forte code strings. Used for lookup internally by PCSet. ‘A’ refers to pitch-class 10, and ‘B’ refers to pitch-class 11.

Classes/TransformationalTools.html#/s:11.name: relativeFromMajor
Classes/TransformationalTools.html#/s:11.abstract: Dictionary mapping roots for the R transformation from major.

Classes/TransformationalTools.html#/s:11.name: leadingToneFromMajor
Classes/TransformationalTools.html#/s:11.abstract: Dictionary mapping roots for the L transformation from major.

Classes/TransformationalTools.html#/s:11.name: transform(_:by:)
Classes/TransformationalTools.html#/s:11.abstract: Perform a standard transformation on some triad represented by a tuplet containing a root and a chord quality. Available transformations are cases in the Transformation enum: P, L, R, N, S, H.

Classes/TransformationalTools.html#/s:11.name: getParallel(_:)
Classes/TransformationalTools.html#/s:11.abstract: Perform a P transformation on some triad represented by a tuplet containing a root and a chord quality.

Classes/TransformationalTools.html#/s:11.name: getRelative(_:)
Classes/TransformationalTools.html#/s:11.abstract: Perform a R transformation on some triad represented by a tuplet containing a root and a chord quality.

Classes/TransformationalTools.html#/s:11.name: getLeadingTone(_:)
Classes/TransformationalTools.html#/s:11.abstract: Perform an L transformation on some triad represented by a tuplet containing a root and a chord quality.

Classes/TransformationalTools.html#/s:11.name: checkSingleTransformation(from:to:)
Classes/TransformationalTools.html#/s:11.abstract: Attempt to identify a single standard transformational mapping between two triads.

Classes/Proportional.html#/s:11MusicianK.name: baseSeconds
Classes/Proportional.html#/s:11MusicianK.abstract: The underlying base absolute-time interval which is scaled.

Classes/Proportional.html#/s:11MusicianK.name: init(baseInterval:)
Classes/Proportional.html#/s:11MusicianK.abstract: Initialize from a base absolute-time interval, also setting the lastInterval property to this interval initially.

Classes/Proportional.html#/s:11MusicianK.name: init(baseInterval:scalingFactor:)
Classes/Proportional.html#/s:11MusicianK.abstract: Initialize from a base absolute-time interval and an initial scaling factor.

Classes/Proportional.html#/s:11MusicianK.name: scale(by:)
Classes/Proportional.html#/s:11MusicianK.abstract: Rescale the current instance’s lastInterval property. Also returns the new absolute-time interval, which can be discarded.

Classes/Metered.html#/s:11MusicianKit7Me.name: timeSignature
Classes/Metered.html#/s:11MusicianKit7Me.abstract: A computed property that reflects the meter property, provided for convenience.

Classes/Metered.html#/s:11MusicianKit7Me.name: BPM
Classes/Metered.html#/s:11MusicianKit7Me.abstract: A computed property that reflects the tempo’s beats-per-minute value, provided for convenience.

Classes/Metered.html#/s:11MusicianKit7Me.name: noteValue
Classes/Metered.html#/s:11MusicianKit7Me.abstract: A NoteValue instance to easily change duration to another regular metric subdivision.

Classes/Metered.html#/s:11MusicianKit7Me.name: init(initialTempo:initialMeter:initialValue:)
Classes/Metered.html#/s:11MusicianKit7Me.abstract: Initialize with a tempo, a meter, and a beat value.

Classes/Duration.html#/s:11MusicianKit8D.name: lastInterval
Classes/Duration.html#/s:11MusicianKit8D.abstract: The most recent absolute-time interval represented by an instance.

Classes/PostTonalTools.html#/s:11Musicia.name: noteMap(_:)
Classes/PostTonalTools.html#/s:11Musicia.abstract: Map a note name to a pitch-class (0 - 11). Returns nil if a direct mapping cannot be found. E.g. noteMap(F) returns 5.

Classes/PostTonalTools.html#/s:11Musicia.name: noteMap24(_:)
Classes/PostTonalTools.html#/s:11Musicia.abstract: Map a note name to a pitch-class (0 - 23) in 24EDO. Returns nil if a direct mapping cannot be found. Uses ‘+’ for quarter-tone-sharp, and ‘d’ for quarter-tone-flat. E.g. noteMap24(Fd) returns 9, noteMap24(G+) returns 15, noteMap24(A) returns 18.

Classes/XenharmonicTools.html#/s:11Music.name: midiParseEDO(_:)
Classes/XenharmonicTools.html#/s:11Music.abstract: Fit an equal division of an octave/diapason (>= 12) to an array of MIDI-note-number-style Doubles.

Classes/XenharmonicTools.html#/s:11Music.name: EDOGetIncrement(_:)
Classes/XenharmonicTools.html#/s:11Music.abstract: Get an increment to use as a generator for some equal division of an octave/diapason.

Classes/Modes/Minor/Melodic.html#/s:11Mu.name: offsets
Classes/Modes/Minor/Melodic.html#/s:11Mu.abstract: Offsets-from-tonic for the current mode, as an array of Ints.

Classes/Modes/Minor/Harmonic.html#/s:11M.name: offsets
Classes/Modes/Minor/Harmonic.html#/s:11M.abstract: Offsets-from-tonic for the current mode, as an array of Ints.

Classes/Modes/Minor/Harmonic.html.name: Harmonic
Classes/Modes/Minor/Harmonic.html.abstract: Harmonic minor modes. Accessed by numbered cases, e.g. Modes.Minor.Harmonic.fifth.offsets returns [0, 1, 4, 5, 7, 8, 10]

Classes/Modes/Minor/Melodic.html.name: Melodic
Classes/Modes/Minor/Melodic.html.abstract: Melodic minor modes. Accessed by numbered cases, e.g. Modes.Minor.Melodic.fifth.offsets returns [0, 2, 3, 5, 7, 8, 10].

Classes/Modes/Major/Harmonic.html#/s:11M.name: offsets
Classes/Modes/Major/Harmonic.html#/s:11M.abstract: Offsets-from-tonic for the current mode, as an array of Ints.

Classes/Modes/Major/Harmonic.html.name: Harmonic
Classes/Modes/Major/Harmonic.html.abstract: Harmonic major modes. Accessed by numbered cases, e.g. Modes.Major.Harmonic.fifth.offsets returns [0, 1, 4, 5, 7, 9, 10].

Classes/Modes.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Mode.name: user
Classes/Modes.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Mode.abstract: A dictionary containing user-defined modes. The key is the mode name.

Classes/Modes.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Mode.name: modalRotate(_:by:)
Classes/Modes.html#/s:11MusicianKit5Mode.abstract: Get offsets for an arbitrary mode of a base collection of offsets.

Classes/Modes/Major.html.name: Major
Classes/Modes/Major.html.abstract: Major modes. Can be accessed by their names or numbered instances. E.g. Modes.Major.ionian is the same as Modes.major.first.

Classes/Modes/Minor.html.name: Minor
Classes/Modes/Minor.html.abstract: Provides harmonic and melodic minor modes through Minor.Harmonic and Minor.Melodic respectively.

Classes/Modes.html.name: Modes
Classes/Modes.html.abstract: Modes** is an abstract class that deals with standard modal collections as well as cataloguing user-generated scales. E.g. Modes.Major.fourth.offsets gives offsets-from-tonic for the lydian mode as an array of Ints, i.e. [0, 2, 4, 6, 7, 9, 11].

Classes/XenharmonicTools.html.name: XenharmonicTools
Classes/XenharmonicTools.html.abstract: XenharmonicTools** is an abstract class and a toolkit for dealing with tuning systems, and more generally with pitch-spaces, outside 12-ED2.

Classes/PostTonalTools.html.name: PostTonalTools
Classes/PostTonalTools.html.abstract: PostTonalTools** is an abstract class and a toolkit for dealing with post-tonal music-theoretic and compositional conventions, including musical group theory, tone rows and matrices, etc.

Classes/Duration.html.name: Duration
Classes/Duration.html.abstract: Duration** is a simple base-class, not intended to be instantiated directly but to allow the Metered and Proportional subclasses to operate interchangeably in some contexts.

Classes/Metered.html.name: Metered
Classes/Metered.html.abstract: Metered** is a subclass of Duration that acts as an abstraction for a duration that has some metric context. The lastInterval property reflects the most recent absolute-time interval represented by an instance.

Classes/Proportional.html.name: Proportional
Classes/Proportional.html.abstract: Proportional** is a subclass of Duration that acts as an abstraction for a duration that is proportional to some base absolute-time interval. The lastInterval property reflects the most recent absolute-time interval represented by an instance.

Classes/TransformationalTools.html.name: TransformationalTools
Classes/TransformationalTools.html.abstract: TransformationalTools** is an abstract class and a toolkit for dealing with neo-riemannian and transformational ideas in musical composition and analysis.

Global Variables.html.name: Global Variables
Global Variables.html.abstract: The following global variables are available globally.
